page.title: 05EDWARD THOMAS
page.content: {Edward Thomas } Born on March 3, 1878 in Lambeth.He was the son of a Board of Trade clerk.He attended various schools,including the boarding school at St.Pauls.He went to Oxford 1897- 1900 . In 1899 he married Helen.Her father, James Noble persuaded him to start writing.He acquired a reputation as a literary critic, especially of contemporary verse,also biographer and editor of classics and anthologies. He was successful,but the pay was little. He had 3 children. In 1907 he moved into Steep. Up to 1915 he had written 37 books but no poetry.In 1917 he was killed in France,having by this time written more than 150 poems. There is an annual walk in his memory in the countryside near his house. The Poet's Stone on Stoner Hill(photo) is a local tourist attraction and a place of pilgrimmage for devotees of Thomas.
